event.name: NEBULA_TRADER
event.text: It's hard to see why, but this beacon is apparently a tourist destination. One of the ships at the small station is offering a deal.

event.name: NEBULA_REBEL_UNDETECTED
event.text: Your ship emerges quite far away from the beacon. You see a Rebel ship waiting nearby, undoubtedly stationed to look for you.
You use your cloaking system to slip further into the nebula undetected.
You immediately slip further into the clouds, but not quickly enough. The Rebel catches sight of you and moves in to engage!

choice.text: (Engines) Fully power the engines to out-run them.

event.text: Your powerful engines allow you to out-distance the ship and eventually lose it within the nebula.
You power down non-essential systems and slip into the cloud. The ship never noticed you.
The ship spots you and gives chase. After some quick maneuvering you were able to lose your pursuers in the clouds. You expect they warned the fleet of your position, however.

event.name: NEBULA_PIRATE_SMUGGLE
event.text: A pirate ship arrives shortly after you. Judging from the fact that it is attempting to avoid your ship, you assume that it's a smuggler trying to stay away from beacons.
You power up your weapons and move in to engage.
It jumps away after a time.
They hail you, "There's no need for aggression... Perhaps this would convince you to look the other way?"

surrender.text: They hail you, "We realize our ship is no match for yours. If you let us go we can make it worth your while."

escape.text: They look like they don't want to fight. They are trying to escape.

gotaway.text: The smuggler jumped away with their goods intact.

event.text: You search the ship and discover that its cargo was new military-grade weaponry! It was somehow undamaged in the fight and can easily be mounted on the ship.
You search the remains of the ship, but only come across blueprints and debris from broken machinery. A shame, but you take what scrap you can salvage.
The ship was transporting weaponry. You find a piece still intact, despite the battle.
The ship was apparently transporting weaponry; however, nothing seems to have survived the battle.
Searching the remains, you find that the cargo was military-grade Drone Schematics! You bring them aboard to install in your ship.
The debris implies that the ship was carrying Drone Schematics, but unfortunately nothing remains. You do find functioning Drone Parts, however.
The ship was carrying military supplies. You pick up anything that looks salvageable from the debris.
With the crew dead, you search the ship. You find military-grade weaponry and take what looks most useful.
Searching the remains you find that the cargo was military-grade Drone Schematics! You bring them aboard to install on your ship.

event.name: NEBULA_LOST_SHIP
event.text: A heavily damaged Federation ship is hiding in the nebula at this beacon. Before you have time to make contact with them, they fade into the nebula.

choice.text: Attempt to follow and help them.

event.text: Your search is hopeless. Your sensors can't pick up anything in the nebula.
While searching fruitlessly through the nebula, you stumble upon the Rebel ship which the Federation loyalists were likely hiding from. You prepare for a fight.
You get lucky and find them floating not too deep into the nebula. Thrilled to be found by friendlies, they come on board and abandon their wrecked ship.

choice.text: Keep your position, they can handle themselves.
(Teleporter) Lock onto their life-signs with your teleporter.

event.text: You beam the Federation crew aboard. One gladly joins your crew, the rest wait to be dropped off at the next station.

choice.text: (Long-ranged Scanners) Pump extra power into your sensors and try to track them.

event.text: Your local radar flickers, periodically showing signs of a large object in the clouds nearby. However it's enough to get coordinates and you find the ship... an empty hull, long since stripped of functioning components.
You follow the faint signatures and find them floating not too far away into the nebula. Thrilled to be found by friendlies, they come on board and abandon their wrecked ship.

event.name: NEBULA_WEAPONS_TRADER
event.text: A black market weapons trader spins you a tale of the dangers of the nebula before pushing his wares.

choice.text: Purchase an unknown weapon for 45 scrap.
(Mind Control) Convince him to make it a better deal.

event.text: You transfer the scrap and receive a weapon in return. Lets hope it was worth it.
You transfer over the scrap, but he reneges on the agreement. "I told you this was a dangerous place!"

choice.text: Learn a valuable lesson and move on.

event.text: Once "convinced" to help he lowers the price and describes the weapon. However, he eventually comes to his senses and confusedly takes back his discount. He is clearly unsure why he offered it in the first place.
You purchase the weapon and thank him for his help.
You thank him for his offer and prepare to move on.

Once "convinced" to help, he casually states that his offer was actually a lie and that they planned to attack your ship. By the time he returns to his senses you've already prepared your ship to fight.

event.name: NEBULA_ROCK_RACIST
event.text: A Rock armoured transport nearby looks to have lost its bearings, but when you hail they grow suspicious: "Whatever life-form you are, we find you repugnant. We seek no aid. Leave. Now."

choice.text: (Rock crewmember) Offer to lead them out of the nebula.

event.text: The Rock grudgingly transfer control of their helm to you and you steer them to a thinner part of the nebula. They're not sure what to think, but transfer over some supplies all the same.

event.name: NEBULA_MANTIS_CHOICE
event.text: Navigating the fog blind, you practically bump hulls with a Mantis ship. They hail you: "Pah! This transgression will be overlooked. Nebula, very dangerous. Next time, humans all die."

choice.text: There won't be a next time. Open fire!
This place is dangerous enough. Move on.

event.name: NEBULA_REBEL_CHASE
event.text: You spot a Rebel ship in the nebula ahead and stay off their radar. Try to engage?
You try and stay out of sight. You doubt they saw you.

choice.text: (Advanced Sensors) Try to track them as you move to engage.

event.text: As soon as they see you they make a run for it. You squeeze what you can out of the malfunctioning sensors and are able to keep track of them long enough to get in firing range.

choice.text: (Long-ranged Scanners) Try to track them as you move to engage.

event.text: As soon as they see you they make a run for it. You squeeze what you can out of the malfunctioning sensors and are able to keep track of them long enough to get in firing range.

choice.text: (Lifeform Scanner) Use their life signatures to follow.

event.text: Your augment's ability to keep track of their life signatures within the nebula proves useful. You catch up to the ship and prepare for a fight.
You follow their vapour trails and surf onto their six o'clock, weapons hot.
Without sensors you can't maintain a lock for long. The Rebels slip away.
You get disoriented in the nebula and lose your bearings completely. It takes some time to get back to the beacon. It's likely the fleet has had time to advance closer to your position.

event.name: STORM_ITEMS
event.text: You jump into the middle of a plasma storm. Multiple recently incapacitated ships loom in the shadows, briefly illuminated by the lightning.

choice.text: Manually search the wreckage for survivors and equipment.

event.text: Despite your caution, the lack of detection equipment allows debris to crash into your ship, damaging the hull. You salvage what you can and prepare to jump before anything worse happens.

Within the ship graveyard you find one ship that seems relatively untouched. On board you find an unconscious passenger, and take them back to the ship. Once awake they offer to join your crew in thanks.

While the crew is off the ship searching through the wrecks, two hulls crash into each other breaking the crew's tethers. You have no time to react as someone is knocked away, floating helplessly into the gaseous clouds...

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, your crewmember was close enough to the ship for the Clone Bay to revive them.

event.text: Among the junk and scrap you find a salvageable drone schematic. You decide to quit while ahead and prepare to jump with your recent find.
Most of the debris is hardly even usable as scrap. However, you eventually find an intact weapon that can be mounted on your ship.

choice.text: Avoid the risk and wait to jump away unscathed.
(Piloting) Have your pilot carefully explore the debris.

event.text: Within the ship graveyard you find one ship that seems relatively untouched. On board you find an unconscious passenger and take him back to the ship. Once awake they offer to join your crew in thanks.
Among the junk and scrap you find a salvageable drone schematic. You decide to quit while ahead and prepare to jump with your recent find.
Most of the debris is hardly even usable as scrap. However, you eventually find an intact weapon that can be mounted on your ship.
Your pilot carefully explores the wrecks, but the storm has taken its toll. Any crew are long-since dead and the floating debris has been scorched beyond repair.

changelog.entry: Added Deal with the devil event to nebula

event.name: WOONA_DEAL_DEVIL
event.text: You enter the peaceful section of nebula with no ships in sight. Suddenly, you hear the loud voice inside your head. "I know what you desire. I can fulfill your darkest wishes. The price is simple - I want your soul."

"Oh, you do not need the soul to live. In fact, I lived without it in this nebula for millions of years. Just sign the contract, and your every wish will come true." A piece of paper materializes on the bridge. It's covered in incomprehensible symbols, the only thing you can read is: "Sign here" above the rectangle.
As you sign the paper, a weapon appears right in your weapon bay. It's an upgraded Burst Laser Mark II. Reliable and powerful. Exactly what you wanted.
As you sign the paper, a weapon appears right in your weapon bay. It's a upgraded Halberd Beam. Slow but deadly. Exactly what you wanted.
As you sign the paper, an augmentation appears on your ship. It's a Weapon Pre-Igniter. You cannot believe your eyes. That's exactly what you wanted.

Your crewmember happens to know this creature personally. "This creature is full of malice and contempt. The deal won't bring you anything good." Your Warped comes up with a better idea: they suggest to sign a deal instead of you.

choice.text: Agree for Warped to sign the contract.

event.text: Your Warped crewmember presses their hand on the paper and bursts up in flames. The voice inside your head turns into a chilling scream. You lose consciousness.
After you come to senses, you find a new weapon installed in your weapon bay. It's an upgraded Burst Laser Mark II. Reliable and powerful.
After you come to senses, you find a new weapon installed in your weapon bay. It's a upgraded Halberd Beam. Slow but deadly.
After you come to senses, you find a new augmentation on your ship. It's a Weapon Pre-Igniter. You cannot believe your eyes.

choice.text: Nobody signs the contract. Charge FTL drive.

event.text: You start charging FTL drive, but cannot. It seems that the creature did not want your soul, but they took all fuel reserves instead. Or did they take your soul too?
You hear shouts and gunshots on the ship. It seems that the creature did not want your soul, but instead they took the souls of your crewmembers. Former friends attack everyone on sight.
More of your former crewmembers turn hostile.
A powerful explosion shakes your ship. Looks like the creature did not want your soul. Instead they haunted your ship and try to destroy it from inside.

event.name: WOONA_STORM_MONSTER
event.text: The nebula is particularly thick at this beacon. The sensors have gone offline, as well as half of high-tech equipment on the ship. The ship can hardly move through the dense gases. The best decision would probably be to charge the FTL drive and hope to leave the dangerous area as soon as possible.

event.name: WOONA_STORM_MONSTER_DETECTED
event.text: A colossal monster with a size of a planet lies ahead of you. It seems to be dormant, but alive, hidden from everyone by dense nebula.

It is hard to miss the giant head of the creature in front of your ship. A shot connects and an eye of enormous size opens. Then another. Then a thousand more. A monster just opens it mouth and that's enough to send your ship flying away towards the local star. It was impossible to see anything with your own eyes, but you will never forget this experience.

choice.text: (Glaive Beam) Make a hole in its head.

event.text: The monster's skin is thick but not enough to resist the sheer power of the Glaive Beam. The brain of the creature was completely destroyed by one lucky shot from tiny starship, leaving planet-sized monster dead in space. There is no reward for this feat, since nobody will believe the story, but you know that you saved the galaxy once again.

changelog.entry: Added Starving Mantis event to nebula

event.name: WOONA_NEBULA_STARVING_MANTIS
event.text: After finishing the jump, you bumped a floating cargo pod located on the beacon. It would be impossible to find it otherwise, without functioning sensors.

A Mantis on your ship is grumpy. To stay alive, Mantis race needs food eight times per day, preferably still moving. You found some cargo but there was no organic food there, just some metal, and the Mantis is starving.
After another hour of waiting, the starving Mantis turns on your crew!
You lure an unaware human to Mantis quarters. The hungry Mantis plunges at them and tears them apart. The whole crew is watching from afar, hoping not to become the next meal.

removeCrew.text: You are lacking biological materials to make a new clone. The Mantis ate them all.

event.text: After a few hours of being conditioned by a Slug, the starving Mantis accepts to change the diet. Instead of being a carnivore, they will become a "ferrovore". To calm the stomach, the Mantis eats some of scrap material from the hold of your ship.

Few people know how exactly FTL fuel is synthesized. It seems that your Engi is one of them. With reverse engineering, they manage to make some kind of nutrient paste out of fuel. The Mantis does not like the taste, but feels full and energetic at the same time.
